s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BACK WINDOW GLASS CLIP AND SPACER

s2.ptxt: Apply Primer G to the installation part of the clips.

atten4.ptxt: If primer is applied to an area that is not specified, wipe off the primer with white gasoline before it dries.

s2.ptxt: Install 3 new spacers and 2 new clips onto the glass as shown in the illustration.

item.ptxt: Allow the primer to dry for 3 minutes or more.
Do not apply too much primer.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BACK DOOR GLASS ADHESIVE DAM

s2.ptxt: Apply Primer G to the glass where the adhesive dam will be installed.

item.ptxt: Allow the primer to dry for 3 minutes or more.
Do not apply too much primer.

s2.ptxt: Remove the peeling paper from the adhesive part of the dam. Install the dam (adhesive side) to the glass (Primer G area) as shown in the illustration.
Using a brush or sponge, apply Primer M to the exposed part of the vehicle body.

item.ptxt: Allow the primer to dry for 3 minutes or more.
Do not apply primer to the adhesive.
Do not apply too much primer.

s2.ptxt: Using a brush or sponge, apply Primer G to the contact surface of the back door glass.

atten4.ptxt: If primer is applied to an area that is not specified, wipe off the primer with white gasoline before it dries.

item.ptxt: Allow the primer to dry for 3 minutes or more.
Do not apply too much primer.

s2.ptxt: Apply adhesive to the back door glass.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Windshield Glass Adhesive or Equivalent

s3.ptxt: Cut off the tip of the cartridge nozzle as shown in the illustration below.

atten4.ptxt: After cutting off the tip, use all adhesive within the time written in the table below.

s3.ptxt: Load the sealer gun with the cartridge.
Apply adhesive to the back door glass as shown in the illustration.

s2.ptxt: Install the back door glass to the vehicle body.

s3.ptxt: Hold the back window glass in place securely with tape or equivalent until the adhesive has hardened.

item.ptxt: Allow the primer coating to dry for 3 minutes or more.
Check that the clips are attached to the vehicle body correctly.
Check the clearance between the vehicle body and glass.

s3.ptxt: Lightly press the front surface of the back door glass to ensure that the back door glass is securely fit to the vehicle body.
Connect the 2 rear window defogger connectors.
Using a scraper, remove any excess or protruding adhesive.

atten4.ptxt: Apply adhesive onto the glass rim.

atten3.ptxt: Do not drive the vehicle within the time written in the table below.

entry.ptxt: Minimum time prior to driving vehicle

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BACK DOOR TRIM BOARD ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Attach the 16 clips to install the back door trim board.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BACK DOOR GLASS CHANNEL LH

atten4.ptxt: When installing the back door glass channel LH, heat the vehicle body using a heat light.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the vehicle body excessively.

s2.ptxt: Clean the vehicle body surface.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the vehicle body surface.
Remove the double-sided tape from the vehicle body.
Wipe off any tape adhesive residue with cleaner.

s2.ptxt: Install a new back door glass channel.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the vehicle body.
Using a heat light, heat the channel.

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the channel excessively.

s3.ptxt: Remove the peeling paper from the face of a new back door glass channel.

atten4.ptxt: After removing the peeling paper, keep the exposed adhesive free from foreign matter.

s3.ptxt: Install a new back door glass channel.

atten4.ptxt: Press the back door glass channel firmly to install it.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BACK DOOR GLASS CHANNEL RH

atten4.ptxt: Use the same procedures described for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL CENTER STOP LIGHT ASSEMBLY (w/ Center Stop Light)

s2.ptxt: Connect the connector.
Install the stop light with the 2 screws.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL CENTER STOP LIGHT COVER (w/ Center Stop Light)
INSTALL REAR WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY (w/ Rear Wiper)

s2.ptxt: Operate the rear wiper, and stop the rear wiper motor at the automatic stop position.
Clean the wiper pivot serrations with a wire brush.
Position the blade tip within the range shown in the illustration.

item.ptxt: Hold down the arm hinge by hand while tightening the nut.
Install the arm and blade so that the rear wiper blade is aligned with the ceramic line.

s2.ptxt: Operate the rear wiper while spraying water or washer fluid on the glass. Ensure that there is no interference between the blade and pillar.
Close the wiper arm head cap.
Conduct a leak test after the adhesive has completely hardened.
Seal any leaks with auto glass sealer.

s-1.ptxt: CONNECT CABLE TO NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL
